title: Integrate with Extended ECM
content:
OpenText Extended ECM (xECM) is an enterprise content management solution that securely governs the information lifecycle. The Service Management and xECM integration enables you to embed an xECM widget in Service Management so that users can leverage the industry-leading content management capabilities powered by xECM. 

Overview

With this integration, Service Management users can launch an embedded xECM widget by clicking the Related documents tab in a record. This offers the following benefits:

  • Enterprise document management: The embedded widget centralizes document storage and access. It ensures that all documents, regardless of their source, are stored securely in one location for easy retrieval and management. 
  • Workflow automation: The embedded widget automates, manages, and tracks document-centric processes. It streamlines tasks, routes documents, assigns responsibilities, ensures compliance, and enhances collaboration for efficient business operations. 
  • Version control: The embedded widget tracks the version history and ensures that everyone accesses and works on the latest document versions, minimizing confusion. 
  • Secure external sharing: This capability enables controlled and audited sharing of documents with external partners, clients, or vendors. This ensures that sensitive data remains protected. 

Set up the integration

To set up the xECM integration, complete the following tasks.

Prerequisites

Before you begin, make sure you have purchased xECM X2 (or above) plans.

Configure Single Sign-On (SSO)

To enable the user to access xECM documents in Service Management without the need to log in to xECM each time, you need to configure Single-Sign-On (SSO) in Azure Active Directory (AD).

Make sure you configure SSO and user synchronization for both Service Management and xECM by following the instructions in:

  • For Azure AD-based SSO configurations for Service Management, see Configure authentication services (LDAP, SAML, OAuth) for on-premises tenants or Configure SAML authentication for SaaS tenants.
  • For user and group synchronization steps, see Integration Studio—Microsoft Azure Active Directory (AD) integration.
  • xECM SSO configurations
  • xECM provisioning configurations

When configuring SSO, be aware of the following:

  • For SSO to work, assign the same set of users to the enterprise applications you added in Azure AD for xECM and Service Management.
  • Use the same Directory Services Azure enterprise application for xECM SSO and provisioning configuration.
  • Take note of the name of the auth handler you configured in OpenText Directory Services (OTDS) as part of the xECM SSO configuration. It's required when enabling xECM in Service Management.
  • Configure the following in OTDS for the user partition that you created during the provisioning configuration:
    • Assign X2 or above license to the partition (Partition > Actions > Allocate to License).
    • Assign the Access to cs access role to the partition (Access role > Actions > View Access Role Details).

Configure Service Management

After configuring SSO, you need to enable xECM in Service Management.

Enable the xECM widget

To enable the xECM widget for desired Service Management record types, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to Agent Interface as the integration administrator.
  2. Go to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Configuration.
  3. In the left-side pane, select Extended ECM.
  4. In the Widget URL field, replace <Content Server URL> and <auth handler> with their actual values.
  5. Select Active to enable the integration.
  6. Click Save.
  7. Click Add to open the Add configuration for record type dialog.
  8. Select the record type to display the xECM widget and save the setting. The system displays the xECM configuration page for the record type.
  9. Select Active to enable the integration for the specified record type.
  10. (Optional) To display a default workspace when the user opens the Related documents tab of a record, enter the ID of the default workspace in Default workspace Id. If you don't specify this field, users will need to enter the desired workspace ID in Workspace Id on the Related documents tab.
  11. Repeat steps 7 through 10 for other record types you want to enable the widget.

Display xECM in Service Management

To display the xECM widget in Service Management, you must configure settings in Service Management and xECM (including OTDS and Content Server).

Configure Service Management

  1. Navigate to Administration > Configuration > Application Settings.
  2. Locate the Content security policy option and click Configure.
  3. Click Add item, and then select Frame-src.
  4. In the Frame-src field, add <OTDS host> <Content Server host> *.microsoftonline.com mailto:.
  5. Click Add item, and then select Frame-ancestors.
  6. in the Frame-ancestors field, add <OTDS host> <Content Server host> *.microsoftonline.com.
  7. Click OK.
  8. Click Save.

Configure OTDS

  1. From the menu bar of the OTDS web administration UI, click Trusted Sites.
  2. On the Trusted Sites page, from the button bar, click Add.
  3. In the Addresses that Directory Services can trust box, enter this URL: https://<Service Management FQDN>.

For details, click Help on the Trusted Sites page to view the related documentation in the OpenText Directory Services: Installation and Administration Guide.

Configure Content Server

  1. Log in to Content Server as a user with sufficient privileges (such as the Web Admin usage privilege).
  2. From the menu, select Admin > Content Server Administration.
  3. Search for and open the Security Parameters page.
  4. In the Trusted Relationships section, add the Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN) of Service Management for the Referring Websites and Cross-Domain fields.
  5. Click Save Changes.

For details, click Help on the Trusted Relationships page to view the related documentation in the System Administration Guide: OpenText Content Server.

Use and manage the integration

Follow these instructions to use and manage the integration. 

Access the xECM widget

To access the xECM widget for a record type, navigate to the record type in Service Management, open a record, and then click the Related documents tab.

If no default workspace has been configured for the record type, enter the node ID of the workspace or folder you want to access and click OK.

You can click Change workspace to switch to another workspace or folder.

Control the display of the xECM widget

To temporarily disable the xECM widget for all record types, go to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Configuration, click Extended ECM in the left pane, clear the Active checkbox, and then click Save.

To temporarily disable the xECM widget for certain record types, go to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Configuration, click the record type under Extended ECM, clear the Active checkbox, and then click Save. Alternatively, you can click the Remove button on the Extended ECM configuration page for a particular record type to disable the xECM widget display.
